text: On 23 November 2021 a Macedonian bus crashed and caught fire in western Bulgaria. The accident happened on the Struma motorway near the village of Bosnek, south-west of Sofia. Fifty passengers and two drivers were on the bus. Forty-five people died in the crash, including twelve children. Seven other passengers suffered burns but survived at first. It is currently the deadliest road accident in Bulgarian history. It is seen as the deadliest bus crash in Europe in a decade. ==References== Category:2021 disasters in Europe 2021 bus crash Category:November 2021 events Category:Transport disasters in Europe
title: 2021 Bulgaria bus crash
